meanings.definition: A practical section of a course of study
meanings.sent1: During the practicum, students apply what they learned in class to real situations.
meanings.sent2: The biology course includes a practicum where students conduct experiments in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The practicum turned into a fun learning experience for the students.
meanings.sent4: Her practicum in the hospital was like diving into a sea of medical knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The practicum was a hands-on opportunity to explore the subject further.

meanings.definition: A period of practical experience in a particular field, especially as part of a course of study
meanings.sent1: The practicum at the engineering firm helped him understand real-world applications of his studies.
meanings.sent2: She completed her practicum at the law office to gain practical skills in the legal field.
meanings.sent3: The practicum at the bakery was a sweet experience for the culinary students.
meanings.sent4: His practicum in marketing opened his eyes to the dynamic world of advertising.
meanings.sent5: The practicum provided valuable hands-on training for the future professionals.
